    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add(BinaryTreeNode<T> nodeToAdd)
        Add nodes to binary tree
        Parameters:
        nodeToAdd - this is the node to add to the tree NOTE: ususally, there would be an item as a parameter of type T. I used a node as it makes it easier to use as i have more than just one item in each node (e.g. a node label)

      • remove

        public boolean remove(BinaryTreeNode<T> parent,
                      BinaryTreeNode<T> nodeToRemove)
        Method to remove nodes from a binary tree
        Parameters:
        parent - , the node before the one to be removed, of type BinaryTreeNode
        nodeToRemove - ,the node to get rid of from the tree, of type BinaryTreeNode
        Returns:
        Boolean true if item has been removed, false otherwise

      • addRemovedNodes

        public boolean addRemovedNodes(BinaryTreeNode<T> tempNode)
        Helper methods to re-add nodes that don't need to be removed
        Parameters:
        tempNode - this is the node which has been removed from the tree
        Returns:
        Boolean, returns true at the end of re-adding all nodes

      • containsNodeName

        public boolean containsNodeName(java.lang.String nodeName,
                                BinaryTreeNode<T> root)
        This checks to ee if the tree has the node with the name specified (the same as contains, but looking at node names is more practical for this progam)
        Parameters:
        nodeName - , the node which needs to be determined if it's in the tree or not, of type String
        root - , the root of the tree, used for taversing the tree, od type BinaryTreeNode
        Returns:
        Boolean true if the node is in the tree, false otherwise

      • size

        public int size(BinaryTreeNode<T> root)
        returns the size of a tree
        Parameters:
        root - this is the beginning of the tree, of type BinaryTreeNode
        Returns:
        int the size of the tree
